public abstract class AbstractTask implements Task {
* @param taskName Name or description of the deadline
* @param preposition English word string to indicate the date clearly (eg. at, by, before, between)

* Constructor for Deadline class with additional info provided after date taken to be time.

* @param preposition English word string to indicate the date clearly (eg. at, by, before, between)
public Deadline(String taskName, String preposition, LocalDate date, String time) {
* @param filePath Pathname of file where Duke tasks are being stored at

* @param preposition English word string to indicate the date clearly (eg. at, by, before, between)
public Event(String taskName, String preposition, LocalDate date) {
* Constructor for Event class with additional info provided after date taken to be time.

public Event(String taskName, String preposition, LocalDate date, String time) {
* Takes in user String input, parses, and executes command accordingly.

* Constructor for Storage located at filepath.

* Adds task of taskName to taskList.

newTask = new Deadline(task, preposition, localDate, time);

newTask = new Event(task, preposition, localDate, time);

System.out.println("     Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* Deletes task of taskName from taskList.
System.out.println("     Noted. I've removed this task: ");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.err.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! Please input a valid number in the range of the task list to delete.");
} catch (NumberFormatException e) { // when non-int arg provided
System.err.println("OOPS!!! Delete must take a valid integer in the range of the task list.");

* Prints out that task is done, and marks task done.
System.out.println("     Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
} catch (IndexOutOfBoundsException e) { // when no int arg provided
System.err.println("OOPS!!! Done must take a valid number in the range of the task list.");
} catch (NumberFormatException e) { // when non-int arg provided
System.err.println("OOPS!!! Done must take a valid integer in the range of the task list.");
* Scans for user input indefinitely and terminates when user inputs "bye".
System.out.println("     Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
private static final LocalDate localDate = LocalDate.parse("2019-02-13");
return new Event("reading event", "at", localDate, time);
assertEquals("[E][✗] reading event at Feb 13 2019", newEvent().toString());
assertEquals("[E][✗] reading event at Feb 13 2019 6pm", newEventWithTime().toString());
